summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2, 2021, concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's legal communications. Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim notifies the government and prison officials of suspected third-party interference with a secure Webex line used for confidential attorney-client communications, contradicting prior assurances from the MDC. The email was initially misdirected to a Bureau of Prisons attorney.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney notifying the government and prison officials of interference with secure communication lines between her client, Ghislaine Maxwell, and counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant who observed suspicious activity on her VTC monitor during a confidential legal communication session.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Copied on the initial notification email from Bobbi Sternheim regarding the communication interference.

connections.description: Sternheim is Maxwell's defense attorney, representing her and raising concerns about breaches in their confidential communications.
Sternheim is communicating a legal issue (interference with attorney-client privilege) to Everdell, who is likely a government or opposing counsel.

events.title: Suspicious VTC Activity Observed
events.description: At the conclusion of a VTC session, Ghislaine Maxwell observed suspicious activity on the monitor and alerted MDC staff. A Case Manager witnessed the activity.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: The Court issued an order referenced by Sternheim, likely concerning the resolution of Maxwell's communication difficulties with counsel.

locations: FMC Butner, Old Highway 75, P.O. Box 1600, Butner, North Carolina 27509
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) - implied location where Maxwell is held
225 Broadway, Suite 715, New York, NY 10007 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, Bobbi Sternheim, reported a new incident of suspected third-party interference with their secure Webex communication line on September 1, 2021.
An MDC Case Manager witnessed the suspicious VTC activity, providing an 'insider' witness to support Maxwell's and her counsel's long-standing complaints.
This incident directly contradicts prior government and MDC Legal assurances to the court that Maxwell's confidential communication issues had been resolved.
The communication was part of a chain where an email was initially mis-sent to a Federal Bureau of Prisons attorney at FMC Butner.
